title: Climate Talk.
sections:
Reading the State of Climate Change from the Web: Top Google Results

The map shows the resonance of the keywords scepticism, mitigation, adaptation and conflict in the top 17 Google results for the query [climate change OR global warming], as retrieved on 27 June 2013. The flow diagram shows that adaptation is followed by conflict taking over from mitigation and scepticism.

[a]

Figure 1. Reading the State of Climate Change from the Web: Top Google Results. Source: Digital Methods Summer School. Date: 24 June - 5 July 2013

How to read the map

The flow diagram shows the resonance of scepticism, mitigation, adaptation and conflict in the global warming and climate change web space, as demarcated through the top Google Search results. The lines represent the presence of each issue in each website, resized according to the frequency of mentions. The total number of mentions for each issue, as well as for each website, is displayed in brackets.

How the map is built

Google Web Search is queried on 27 June 2013 for [climate change OR global warming]. The queries are done through a research browser, which minimizes personalization effects based on an individual’s search history, location and given preferences. The top results are captured and cleaned with the Digital Methods Initiative Harvester tool. The top 17 deep links are queried for [skeptic], [mitigation], [adaptation] and [conflict] with the DMI Google Scraper or Lippmannian Device. The tool queries each individual URL for the number of mentions of each keyword in a batch fashion.

[a]We added the query ‘conflict’ to the project so we need to have conflict as an issue reflected in the graph. The data for this query can be found here: https://drive.google.com/?tab=mo&authuser=0#folders/0B62v418roMdaR0tOanY0SkVpcTA
